intro: Quercus toza var. vulgaris, commonly known as the common oak, is a deciduous tree belonging to the Fagaceae family. It is characterized by its lobed leaves, which turn vibrant shades of red and yellow in autumn. The tree produces acorns, which are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in mixed forests. Its bark is rough and fissured, providing a distinctive appearance.
